transcripts.text: You're watching one of a series of videos where Elisa Childers and I respond to 23 progressive Christian claims, kind of like a progressive Christian manifesto that was written by Ragamuffin TV.  We deal with these claims, some good, some bad, some ugly, and I'm hoping that this helps you to think biblically.

Number 10 here is very similar to number seven.  So it says no one is saved because they picked the right religion any more than they are condemned because they picked the wrong one.  There's that word again, picked.  They picked the wrong religion or picked the right one.  What would you say about that?

Well, I would agree with that, although I couldn't just sign off because there's a difference between the way they're wording it and what they really mean by it, right?  Mm-hmm.  And so it's written so that they can try to get you to agree with the wording, but I can't agree with what they want to do with it.  So let me put it this way.  No criminal goes to prison for just picking the wrong occupation.
Well, that's true, right?  Yeah.  I'd agree with that.  But, I mean, if stealing cars and running a chop shop is the occupation you've chosen, then I guess you sort of do.

So religion, our whole idea of picking religion is about a relational decision to accept or reject the God of creation.  And when you view it in that light and you go, oh, hold on, I'm not just picking a religion.  I'm choosing to embrace and worship and love the God of creation or to create idols and worship false images and and reject him.

OK, so then picking religion takes on a whole different connotation.  I think the theme we're getting in these questions is let's just dumb everything down as much as possible so we can create caricatures and misrepresentations of things.  Yeah, these are just talking points.  They're just like empty talking points.  Yeah.  And I feel like in discussion with the progressive Christian, you're going to constantly find yourself having to say, but wait, but I'm not saying that.  Yeah.

Yeah.  And it's just, it actually makes me sad when I read some of these because I just want whoever wrote this to understand the beautiful gift of salvation, but it doesn't seem that they understand that even to start with.

I'm going to be putting up one of these videos every single day until the entire series is uploaded on my channel with a playlist.  So you might want to subscribe if you want to get those notifications.  But if you can't wait, there's links to the two video interviews in large form that I already did on Elisa Childers' channel down below.
